sentences.english: Lots lush green areas for you to enjoy.
sentences.chinese: 地段上鬱鬱蔥蔥的綠化區讓您享受。

sentences.english: A grotto in the forest, leafy, dense and dark.
sentences.chinese: 在鬱鬱蔥蔥的森林中，一個洞穴依稀可見。

sentences.english: Out the left-side window, the fields were a vivid green.
sentences.chinese: 從左邊車窗望出去，田野鬱鬱蔥蔥。

sentences.english: The high mountains around Yellowstone are covered with evergreen forests.
sentences.chinese: 黃石湖周圍的高山上佈滿了鬱鬱蔥蔥的叢林。

sentences.english: The street is beautiful , with trees and flowers growing well along it.
sentences.chinese: 沿街有鬱鬱蔥蔥的樹與花襯托出街道的美麗。

sentences.english: It's lush with panache and power.
sentences.chinese: 這是鬱鬱蔥蔥的以耀目和權力。

sentences.english: I walked over to the edge of the cliff and stood gazing out at what seemed endless green and trees.
sentences.chinese: 我走到懸崖邊，凝視着那一片鬱鬱蔥蔥的樹木。

sentences.english: The building and boardwalks frame the rain gardens and broom sedge meadows.
sentences.chinese: 建築與木棧道環繞着雨水花園與鬱鬱蔥蔥的莎草地。

sentences.english: On Moorea, a white horse browses a lush glen.
sentences.chinese: 在莫雷阿島上，一匹白馬在鬱鬱蔥蔥的山谷裏喫草。

sentences.english: The primitive forest is lush and green, with a sense of vitality everywhere around it.
sentences.chinese: 原始森林鬱鬱蔥蔥，到處散發着勃然生機。

definition: green grass like cushion (idiom); green meadow so inviting to sleep on
(of an area) to have trees with shade-giving foliage/(of a road) to be tree-lined
all the colors in profusion (idiom); a garish display
covering the whole land/over hills and dales
